channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report E-2023100786
item.description:
Report E-2023100786

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: MONTICELLO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NTH experienced a UN1951, Argon, Refrigerated Liquid release from a 400-pound cylinder. ERTS dispatched contractors for cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and monitored the off gassing of the cylinder. Once it reached 0 psi caution tape was placed around the unit and the trailer was closed for shipment on. No waste was generated.

item.title: Report E-2023100655
item.description:
Report E-2023100655

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: LAKELAND
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 10, 2023, nine (9) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted loading dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. HES personnel restacked the undamaged cargo for normal transport. All spent absorbents and damaged pails were collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023100102
item.description:
Report X-2023100102

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: SAINT PETERSBURG
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the unloading of trailer package was identified as leaking and box wet. The box was placed in a Hazmat bag in a Hazmat container for containment and further review. DescribePack: Closures on the 4 bottles cap not secure and loose during shipping. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed in a Hazmat bag in a Hazmat container for containment and further review.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023091085 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO QA, UPON INSPECTION LOOSE CAP. NOT EN OUGH PACKING MATERIAL USED. A LOT OF NEGATIVE SPACE ALLOWING CONTENTS TO SHIFT ON IMPACT. BOTTLE CAP NOT SECURED AND NOT PACKED WELL ENOUGH TO PREVENT MOVEMENT UPON IMPACT. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PUT INSIDE HAZMAT TOTE AND STORED IN HAZMAT CAGE. 2. X-2023091087 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO QA, UPON INSPECTION LOOSE CAP. NOT EN OUGH PACKING MATERIAL USED. A LOT OF NEGATIVE SPACE ALLOWING CONTENTS TO SHIFT ON IMPACT. BOTTLE CAP NOT SECURED AND NOT PACKED WELL ENOUGH TO PREVENT MOVEMENT UPON IMPACT. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PUT INSIDE HAZMAT TOTE AND STORED IN HAZMAT CAGE

item.title: Report X-2023081016
item.description:
Report X-2023081016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-24T00:32:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/24/2023, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5190395 at the station location in Miami, reporting a flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of 4 fiberboard boxes, each containing 4 metal cans. One of the cans leaked due loose closure, resulting in spillage. The entire shipment is being held and the affected pacakge has been placed in a salvage drum and await an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.
